hypothesis_content.title: Neutral Regime Breakout False Signal Reversal
hypothesis_content.statement: When NEUTRAL regime shows initial signs of breaking toward BULL (price > 20-day upper Bollinger Band) but fails to confirm with volume, a reversal back into the mean occurs within 2-3 days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: NEUTRAL regimes are characterized by range-bound behavior. Breakouts without volume confirmation or fundamental catalysts are often false signals as market lacks conviction for sustained trend. High cross-crypto correlation suggests herd behavior rather than organic buying.
entry_conditions: BTC price crosses above 20-day upper Bollinger Band
Volume on breakout day is below 30-day average volume

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price returns to middle Bollinger Band or 3% gain
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price sustains >2% above upper Bollinger Band for 2 days

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If >60% of low-volume breakouts from NEUTRAL regime lead to sustained trends (price remains outside Bollinger Band for 5+ days)
